thread.title: Arsene Wenger warns his squad they must start showing up in big games ahead of Liverpool clash
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger warns his squad they must start showing up in big games ahead of Liverpool clash

author: John Cross
title: Arsene Wenger warns his squad they must start showing up in big games ahead of Liverpool clash
text:
Sport Arsene Wenger warns his squad they must start showing up in big games ahead of Liverpool clash The Gunners have only managed two wins from their last 18 away games against their top six rivals Share Wenger is demanding a big game from his squad this weekend (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger has warned his Arsenal players they need to start showing up in big games. 
Incredibly, Arsenal have managed just two wins from their last 18 away games at their top six rivals Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United, Tottenham and Chelsea. 
And both of those wins - at Tottenham and Manchester City - came when Mesut Ozil was not playing with the Germany midfielder also a big doubt for the trip to Anfield because of illness. 
Ozil, who was struggling with a cold, missed training this week and Wenger admitted he is unsure he will be fit. But Ozil was injured for the win at Tottenham in March 2014 and an unused substitute at City in January 2015. Ozil is a doubt for the Anfield clash (Photo: David Price) 
If they are forced to play without him, then Arsenal might have to play a different way to end their big game curse. 
Wenger insists that Arsenal must deliver a big performance at Anfield to lift morale for their run-in as they chase a place in the top four and they are still in the FA Cup. 
Gunners boss Wenger said: “Everybody owes us a performance. If you play for Arsenal, you always owe us a performance. You cannot say you want to play for Arsenal and not perform. Everybody wants to perform of course. 
“What is linked many times with belief is being in a passive mode and not being proactive, you have to make things happen. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
